IRS990.MissionDesc: THE PURPOSE OF THE ORGANIZATION IS TO RAISE AND DISTRIBUTE FUNDS TO OTHER QUALIFIED SECTION 501(C)(3) ORGANIZATIONS. PRIMARILY, THE ORGANIZATION GRANTS FUNDS TO OTHER EXEMPT ORGANIZATIONS THAT PROMOTE EDUCATION AND MEDICAL RESEARCH, AND ASSIST FAMILIES INCLUDING LOW-INCOME FAMILIES AND CHILDREN.
IRS990.Desc: THE DISTRIBUTION OF GRANTS FURTHERED THE ORGANIZATION'S EXEMPT PURPOSE BY ASSISTING OTHER EXEMPT ORGANIZATIONS WHICH PROMOTE EDUCATION, HEALTH CARE, AND ALLEVIATE POVERTY WITH AN ADDITIONAL FOCUS ON ORGANIZATIONS PROVIDING COVID-19 RELIEF EFFORTS.

RecipientBusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: BIG BROTHERS BIG SISTERS OF CENTRAL ARIZONA
CHRYSALIS SHELTER FOR VICTIMS OF DOMESTIC VIOLENCE
BOYS HOPE GIRLS HOPE OF ARIZONA

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ALL GRANTS REQUIRE A FORMAL APPLICATION WHICH INCLUDES THE 501(c)(3) APPROVED LETTER AND AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. IF THE GRANTEE IS NEW, A SITE VISIT WILL BE PERFORMED PRIOR TO APPROVAL.
TREASURER REVIEWS FORM 990 AND DISCUSSES WITH DIRECTOR PRIOR TO SIGNING.
FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST.
OFFICERS ARE NOT COMPENSATED BY THE ORGANIZATION.

Cardinals Charities follows the conflict of interest policy of their related entity, The Arizona Cardinals. The policy applies to all board members and/or employees of Cardinals Charities. Should any board member and/or employee of Cardinals Charities have any conflict of interest in regards to transactions involving purchases, contracts, leases, or the media, he or she must disclose such conflict of interest to the CFO of the Arizona Cardinals as soon as possible.
